name: Overview
data: [{"id":"5ee6555c-47b4-45e7-87d1-581e5835cbf7","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"as_graph","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d5966089-5433-44f4-be43-c07b40040716","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Overview","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4538ce5b-bf92-494f-8d22-997308ffa427","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"as_graph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" file is part of the Jarvis formatting layer and provides functionality for generating an abstract representation of an Autonomous System (AS) graph. It focuses on transforming low-level call graph data into a clean, structured format that can be easily consumed by other components.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"26601fa2-b15c-43ce-b31e-5216fbb5e572","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This file acts as a bridge between graph generation logic and higher-level tooling such as analyzers, visualizers, or exporters. By isolating formatting concerns, it helps keep the overall architecture modular and maintainable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"584e2ea3-876e-4fcb-97d7-dd58b86245fe","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"96d5cfd9-11d8-44af-9436-05a0319c2df8","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Purpose","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a13f9cd1-7dbb-49c5-9c14-869bb3b5b9c7","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The primary goal of the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"as_graph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" file is to standardize how AS graph data is exposed to the rest of the system. Instead of working directly with complex internal graph objects, consumers receive a simple dictionary-based structure that is safer and easier to manipulate.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2330456f-9464-4ef8-9ec7-4548e2c0cd0d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key responsibilities include:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"af9d6673-4e13-43ea-a9fc-40f57c08f5ff","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Retrieving raw AS graph data from a call graph generator","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2207fece-7db5-49a8-94bc-950f26e8374a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Extracting relevant name-pointer information","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"761ceeee-4126-4e44-8750-55f9d73e377e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Producing a predictable and immutable-friendly output format","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e43f14b4-6a62-424f-909f-85c7366923e3","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"f6e1711a-39c3-4f64-b931-d3a10233daa5","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Design Overview","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bf0d2b00-1467-4a97-85e6-becb162e252f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The file defines a formatter class that follows a common interface shared across Jarvis formatters. This design ensures consistency and makes it easy to introduce new formatters without affecting existing consumers.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"67373842-9e26-44d4-b9fa-e863fa6f92bf","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The formatting logic is intentionally lightweight:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6d4903b6-07c0-42bd-859b-1798c4303ebe","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"No graph mutation is performed","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0bdd1eb1-ec36-4e00-8fa5-b36e7034923c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Data makes the output suitable for both automated processing and human summary, the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"as_graph","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" file encapsulates the logic required to convert raw AS graph data into a clean, consistent, and reusable format. It plays a key role in decoupling graph generation from graph consumption within the Jarvis ecosystem, improving clarity, flexibility, and maintainability.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8c888487-483e-4586-8086-a63e67cff439","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
